result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric Ousley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessessments.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil  judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy, and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Uruba L.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Anger management assessment. Cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment .  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric Ousley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCNG HEARING Transcript (40 pages) commencing OCTOBER 8, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 174 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Uruba L.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Telephone call received from Attorney Malone.  He has to attend to a family emergency.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a lenghty sentencing on another matter.  Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. this date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Malone involved in a jury trial in another court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the Amended Information and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Cedric Ousley in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.   Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Matter to remain calendared for Jury Trial.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL HEARING IN BRANCH 21.
Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Cedric Ousley in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on warrant. Arguements heard as to bail. Case already had a staus date selected of 07/16/2015 at 8:30. Case adjourned to Branch 21.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Parties contacted to scheduled a return on warrant in Branch 21.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($5,000.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  Megan Carmondy for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court. Case in court to address Justice Point Violation (GPS Violation-Tampering). Court will keep the jury trial scheduled for 08/10/2015 on the calendar and set a status date before then. 
   
For reasons stated on the record, and to address the violation, the Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and ordered any bail forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report (GPS violation- tampering) received and filed. Parties contacted, and violation will be addressed on 06/25/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Michael Lonski for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs the Court that their witnesses have been served.  Modification of GPS monitoring proceeded.  Court allows defendant's release from GPS monitoring to go to the Milwaukee Police Department, District 1 on 12th and Vliet to register as a sex offender and to apply for food stamps on Thursday, June 18, 2015 from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.  Court also allows for defendant to go to the laundry mat to wash his clothes at 2227 W. National Avenue on Monday's from 12:00 noon to 2:00 p.m.   Matter to remain on for Jury Trial.
Justice Point Report
The defendant was arraigned on the amended information that was filed on 4/8/2015. Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and electronic monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Cedric Ousley in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for jury trial.  State moved for an adjournment to have more time to locate their essential witness. Court granted the State's request for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

FILED BY THE STATE:
- Demand for Discovery
-Witness List
-Requested Jury Instructions
-Motion in Limine

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Amended information filed by the state on today amending the penalty statue only.  Defendant not produced; arraignment to be held on jury trial date.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 5-18-15 at 9:00 a.m.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Cedric Ousley not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture; speedy trial demand entered on last date.  Parties advised that any and all motions MUST be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions MUST be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Cedric Ousley in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Uruba L.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cedric Ousley in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  
Defendant Cedric Ousley in custody.  
Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
